instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting fully, tried practically everything.
threads.message:
I am getting the strangest issues lately..
This MacBook Air 2017 is not booting; the loading bar takes a long time to fill up, and then it's stuck.
In verbose mode, it stops and waits for the iGPU apparently: keeps repeating this line every 60seconds:

busy timeout[0], (60s): 'IGPU'
busy timeout[1], (60s): 'IGPU'
etcetera..

I have tried with everything disconnected but known-good IO board and LCD.
Even tried only external screen.
Tried booting up several different known good flash drives with different OS-es: all same thing.

Tried cleaning ME region (with Medusa2)
Tried using 3 different 00165 BIOS files found all over the web (with or without cleaning the ME-region after writing it to the board).

Anyone have any ideas?

*EDIT: by the way, this board is absolutely clean.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting fully, tried practically everything.
threads.message: Probably bad CPU would not be surprised at all

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting fully, tried practically everything.
threads.message:
Could be CPU issue.
Try to boot Linux, or Windows; let see if anything change.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting fully, tried practically everything.
threads.message: Got a Ubuntu boot disk: boots up fine, everything works

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting fully, tried practically everything.
threads.message:
Install Intel graphics now and see if still good.
It may used generic one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting fully, tried practically everything.
threads.message:
ok, so that would basicaly tell me if the intel gpu is defective right?
what else could it be at this point..? I mean, i dont have a lot of time to start fiddling with ubuntu-drivers and such, and basically this is boiling down to either a bad cpu or integrated gpu right?

threads.message: Just to let you know, i installed the intel graphics drivers for ubuntu, and everything works properly. so i am now assuming its a RAM issue? Weird that it works perfectly on Ubuntu..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting fully, tried practically everything.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting fully, tried practically everything.
threads.message:
Just an update for people reading this topic with similar issues

Got an email from the customer that the MacBook Air suddenly decided to boot up fully (he sent me a photo of the login screen)
This absolutely baffles me. have no clue what the issue was and will probably never know now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting fully, tried practically everything.
threads.message:
Thanks to Discord chat, piernov and ChrisB, we found a solution for this problem. 
<TRANSISTOR>Q1920</TRANSISTOR> is a Strap to temporarily disable ME region. I had 2 boards, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, both with the same "boots till 100% than freezes" and "iGPU kext timeout" in Verbose mode. 
3437 had some water damage on <RESISTOR>R9120</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R9121</RESISTOR>, 00165 was completely clean but after i repaired the first one i've found that there was a low resistance between GND and SPI_DESCRIPTOR_OVERRIDE_L lines.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting fully, tried practically everything.
threads.message: Thanks for posting this. Will have a look at that next time still weird that it works now though.
